title: Similar to Bank Gothic
content:
Please help me identify this font. It is very close to Bank Gothic, but not quite.  
Thank you!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317113953im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Logo-FontID_4096.png)

Font: 

 Zekton 

Solved By: 

 [fvilanakis](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317113953/http:/typophile.com/user/176276 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Logo-FontID.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317113953/http:/typophile.com/files/Logo-FontID.png) | 5.74 KB |
author: BK_Lounge

comments.content: It must be **[Zekton](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317113953/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Typodermic&ffam=Zekton%20-%20Regular&fid=c917da1eda2501ba071e0adb0399d333&fsize=36&text=MECHANICAL%20SERVICE%20DATA%20POWER%20TECHNOLOGY&wrap=2)** by Ray Larabie (Typodermic, 2000)
